description.narrative: This project aims to fight against the spread of the coronavirus in border areas, particularly in the municipality of Lascahobas, through activities to raise awareness among the population in order to encourage them to use barrier measures and adopt responsible and respectful behaviour towards people returning from the Dominican Republic and those infected with the virus. Advocacy activities will be carried out with decision-makers in order to respect the rights of people living in border areas as they are often left to their own devices in the face of the danger that causes the migratory flow in the context of this pandemic. This response has been chosen because migrants and inhabitants of border areas are doubly affected by the impact of this crisis. Firstly, migrants are forced to return home by the context, secondly, traders are the main victims of the cessation of activities in border markets and thirdly, the households that receive their relatives repatriated or returned from the Dominican Republic become more vulnerable.

Beneficiaries are able to protect themselves against COVID-19 by adopting appropriate barrier measures. They also adopt human rights respectful behaviour towards migrants returning from the Dominican Republic and people infected with the virus. They are able to work for the good of their community.
